intro: Sida fulva, commonly known as yellow mallow, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It is characterized by its hairy, yellow flowers and heart-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, disturbed soils and can be found in wetlands and along stream banks. Sida fulva is part of the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. It is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and provide habitat for wildlife.
